etymologies: late 19th century: from German Syntonie ‘state of being syntonic’+ -ic

definitions: (of a person) responsive to and in harmony with their environment so that affect is appropriate to the given situation
shortDefinitions: (of person) responsive to and in harmony with their environment so that affect is appropriate to given situation

definitions: (of a psychiatric condition or psychological process) consistent with other aspects of an individual's personality and belief system
shortDefinitions: (of psychiatric condition or psychological process) consistent with other aspects of individual's personality and belief system

definitions: relating to or denoting the lively and responsive type of temperament that was considered liable to bipolar disorder.
shortDefinitions: of lively and responsive type of temperament formerly considered liable to bipolar disorder
